citation.biblCit: Odynak, David; Russell, Fran, 2015, "University of Alberta Graduand Survey, 1993", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10606, UAL Dataverse, V3

stdyInfo.abstract: The 1993 Graduand Survey was undertaken to assist the University of Alberta in its on-going efforts to improve the quality of education received by students. Most of the 1993 survey questions were repeated from the 1992 Graduand Survey, since the objective is to develop an over-time data base that will allow a systematic monitoring of the University's efforts to achieve its teaching goals.

sumDscr.geogCover: Alberta, City of Edmonton, University of Alberta
sumDscr.universe: All students graduating from undergraduate or professional programs were surveyed, and completed questionnaires were received from 1453 graduates (35 percent of those graduating). Respondents appeared to by typical of the population of graduates although women were somewhat more likely to respond. This sampling bias was taken into account in data analyses by comparing responses by gender.

othrStdyMat.relMat: Krahn, Harvey, and Brian J. Silzer. "A Study Of Exit Surveys: The Graduand Survey At The University Of Alberta." College And University 71.1 (1995): 12-23. ERIC.
